description: Yeast nucleoporin able to form bona fide prions. The associated benefits are unknown.
Regulatory yeast prion. New1 potentially has a regulatory role in prion state in yeast, working independently of the Hsp104 system.

Tia1/Pub1 is a stress granule component carrying a Q/N-rich prion domain. Tia1 forms a prion in yeast. Moreover, it acts cooperatively with release factor Sup35/eRF3 to establish a two-protein self-propagating state. This complex is most probably implicated in protein synthesis at the site of microtubule assembly.
Regulatory yeast prion. Lsm4 forms an amyloid in vivo, which seems to play a crucial role in the elimination of the three major prions [PSI+], [URE3], and [RNQ+].
Formation of the zona pellucida (ZP), that is an extracellular matrix surrounding and protecting mammalian and fish oocytes. ZP is also responsible for sperm binding.
Formation of the zona pellucida (ZP), that is an extracellular matrix surrounding and protecting mammalian and fish oocytes. ZP is also responsible for sperm binding.
Regulatory yeast prion. The prion formed by the Mot3 transcription factor, [MOT3+], governs the acquisition of facultative multicellularity in the budding yeast.
Regulatory yeast prion. The Mod5 prion conversion in yeast regulates the sterol biosynthetic pathway for acquired cellular resistance against antifungal agents.

protein_name: Neuronal cytoplasmic polyadenylation element-binding protein, CPEB Isoform-1
description: Role in learning and memory. CPEB employs a prion mechanism to create stable, finely tuned self-perpetuating biochemical memories, which might be used in the local homeostatic maintenance of long-term learning-related changes in synaptic morphology and function.
Regulatory yeast prion. RNA binding protein with a low complexity domain formimg a dynamic subcellular matrix in which RNA metabolism takes place.

Miraculin-like proteins, belonging to the Kunitz superfamily, are natural plant defense agents against pests and predators. Murraya koenigii miraculin-like protein (MKMLP) gradually precipitates below pH 7.5 and forms amyloid fibres.
Common cause of hepatic amyloidosis in the USA.

DewA is a highly surface-active protein that spontaneously self-assembles into amphipathic monolayers at hydrophobic:hydrophilic interfaces. These monolayers are composed of fibrils that are a form of functional amyloid. Predicted region of amyloid fibre formation: 68-81.

Tia1/Pub1 is a stress granule component carrying a Q/N-rich prion domain. Tubulin-associated complex containing Pub1 and Sup35 oligomers normally exists in yeast, and its assembly depends on prion domains of Pub1 and Sup35. This Sup35/Pub1 complex, which also contains TUB1 mRNA and components of translation machinery, is important for the integrity of the tubulin cytoskeleton.

protein_name: Amyloid lambda 6 light chain variable region PIP, 6aJL2, mutant
description: Pathogenic amyloid implicated in AL amyloidosis/multiple myeloma.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in AL amyloidosis/multiple myeloma.
Bacterial biofilm formation.
HNRPDL is linked to the development of limb-girdle muscular dystrophy 1G. HNRPDL inclusion bodies display characteristic amyloid hallmarks and are highly neurotoxic.

Rim4 forms amyloid-like aggregates and it is the amyloid-like form of Rim4 that is the active, translationally repressive form of the protein. Rim4 aggregation is a developmentally regulated process. Starvation induces the conversion of monomeric Rim4 into amyloid-like aggregates, thereby activating the protein to bring about repression of translation.
Bacterial biofilm formation. FapC is the main fibril monomer.
Formation of fungal coat by self-assembly at the water-air interface.
Regulatory yeast prion [PIN+]. The [PIN(+)] prion increases the frequency with which the [PSI(+)] or [URE3] prions arise de novo.
Channel-forming bacteriocin achieving its antimicrobial activity through membrane disruption.
Peptide hormones are stored in the form of functional amyloids in pituitary secretory granules.
Silkmoth chorion is a natural protective amyloid.
Cold water fish survive at low temperatures by virtue of 'antifreeze' plasma proteins in the blood that bind to ice crystals and prevent these from growing.

Transient overproduction of a glutamine-rich region of Cyc8 induced a heritable dominant cyc8(-) phenotype that is transmitted cytoplasmically and is dependent on the chaperone Hsp104. Cyc8 prionization could lead to mass activation or repression of yeast genes.
Regulatory yeast prion. Formation of the [SWI(+)] prion results in a partial loss-of-function phenotype for Swi1.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in familial visceral amyloidosis.
NPM1 mutants where the CTD is not properly folded could be implicated in the pathogenesis of acute myeloid leukemia (AML).
Bacterial biofilm formation. Major constituent of the extracellular cell wall sheaths encasing the methanogenic archaea Methanosaeta thermophila PT.
Bacterial biofilm formation. FapB is an amyloid protein, probably a nucleator for FapC polymerization.
S100A8 and A9 form amyloids in the ageing prostate.
S100A8 and A9 form amyloids in the ageing prostate.
Interaction with host, bacterial biofilm formation.
Interaction with host, bacterial biofilm formation.

protein_name: Phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase regulatory subunit alpha SH3 domain
description: Found to form amyloid fibrils in vitro under acidic conditions, biologically probably not relevant.
Amyloid state contributes to build a physical barrier that impedes the transfer of elements between genetically incompatible strains.

Regulatory yeast prion inducing the [URE3] phenotype. This phenotype occurs at a frequency of 10(-5) in haploid yeast strains, is reversible, and its frequency is increased by overexpressing the URE2 gene.
Regulatory yeast prion governing translation termination efficiency in [PSI+] strains.
RepA amyloid formation is induced by binding to origin DNA sequences (iterons). RepA amyloid assemblies could have a role in the negative regulation of plasmid replication.
Amyloid fibre formation under destabilizing conditions by the apo form. Used as model protein, amyloid formation is biologically probably not relevant.
Formation of aerial structures.
Elimination of toxic intermediates during melanin synthesis.
Implicated in insulin-derived amyloidosis, which is a rare, yet significant complication of insulin therapy.

A series of peptides corresponding to native beta-strands readily form amyloid aggregates that are also capable of seeding fibril formation by a full-length form of beta-lactoglobulin in which the disulfide bonds are reduced. The biological relevance of this is not known.
Amyloid fibre formation under destabilizing conditions, used as model protein. The amyloid formation is probably not functionally relevant.

Amphoterin (also known as HMG-1, involved in neuronal development) contains an amyloidogenic peptide fragment which is highly homologous to the Alzheimer's amyloid beta-peptide. The functional relevance of this is not yet elucidated.

Plasma apolipoproteins, including human apolipoprotein C-II that forms amyloid fibres in its lipid-free form, show alpha-helical structure in the lipid-bound state and limited conformational stability in the absence of lipid. This may accounts for the high propensity of apolipoproteins to aggregate and accumulate in disease-related amyloid deposits.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in calcifying epithelial odontogenic tumors and unerupted tooth follicles.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in Icelandic-type cerebral amyloid angiopathy.
Implicated in insulin-derived amyloidosis, which is a rare, yet significant complication of insulin therapy.

Residues 1-22 of the cold shock protein CspB form amyloid fibrils when solutions containing this peptide in aqueous (50%) acetonitrile are diluted in water. Amyloid formation is biologically probably not relevant.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in familial corneal amyloidosis.
Peptide hormones are stored in the form of functional amyloids in pituitary secretory granules.
Peptide hormones are stored in the form of functional amyloids in pituitary secretory granules.

Merozoite surface protein 2 (MSP2), an abundant glycosylphosphatidylinositol-anchored protein on the surface of Plasmodium falciparum merozoites that forms amyloid-like fibrils in solution under physiological conditions. It may be a component of the fibrillar surface coat on P. falciparum merozoites.
Some of the lysozyme mutants in humans cause systemic amyloidosis. Hen egg white lysozyme (HEWL) has been well studied as a model protein of amyloid fibrils formation.
PAPf39, a 39-residue peptide fragment from human prostatic acidic phosphatase forms amyloid fibrils in semen (SEVI), which increase HIV infectivity by up to 5 orders of magnitude.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in glaucoma.
p53 aggregation can lead to loss-of-function (LoF), dominant-negative (DN) and gain-of-function (GoF) effects, with adverse cancer consequences.
Dermaseptin S9 (Drs S9) is an atypical cationic antimicrobial peptide with a long hydrophobic core and with a propensity to form amyloid-like fibrils.

protein_name: Transforming growth factor beta-induced protein, TGFBIp, A546T
description: TGFBIp A546T amyloid formation is implicated in lattice corneal dystrophy (LCD), which manifests as amyloid-type aggregates in the corneal stroma.
Ovalbumin (OVA) is a major globular protein in egg white that forms semiflexible fibrillar aggregates during heat-induced gelation.
Human D-crystallin is an eye lens protein that aggregates into amyloid fibrils under acidic conditions, which makes it a major component of cataracts.

An A-crystallin-derived peptide, A66-80 (1.8 kDa), is a prominent LMW peptide concentrated in water-insoluble fractions of the aging lens. The peptide has amyloid-like properties and preferentially insolubilizes -crystallin from lens-soluble fractions causing age-related cataract formation.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in Finnish type amyloidosis.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in Alzheimers disease.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in type 2 diabetes and insuloma.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in Alzheimers disease.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in Parkinsons disease.
Amyloid form implicated in human lung disease.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in haemodialysis-associated amyloidosis.
Pathogenic amyloidosis implicated in familial visceral amyloidosis.
Implicated in isolated atrial/cardiac amyloid.
Medin amyloid is commonly deposited in the aging aortic media.
Peptide hormones are stored in the form of functional amyloids in pituitary secretory granules.
Peptide hormones are stored in the form of functional amyloids in pituitary secretory granules.

Pathogenic amyloid implicated in Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD), fatal familial insomnia (FFI), Gertsmann-Straussler-Scheinker syndrome (GSS), kuru and variably protease-sensitive prionopathy (VPSPr).
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in senile seminal vesicle amyloid.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in senile systemic amyloidosis.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in familial subepithelial corneal amyloidosis.
Implicated in corpora amylacea.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in systemic amyloidosis.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in medullary carcinoma of the thyroid.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in familial visceral amyloidosis.
Prolactin-derived amyloid fibres can be deposited in the aging pituitary gland, causing prolactinoma.
The antimicrobial PG-1 induces strong cytotoxic activities on cell membrane by its channel-forming ability.
Antimicrobial peptide which exerts its cytotoxic effects as a result of membrane disruption.
Implicated in long-term memory in Drosophila.
Bacterial biofilm formation.
Harpins are virulence factors in a plant pathogenic bacteria.
Peptide hormones are stored in the form of functional amyloids in pituitary secretory granules.

protein_name: TAR DNA-binding protein of 43 kDa, TDP-43
description: A major deposited protein in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis and frontotemporal dementia with ubiquitin.
Possesses antifungal activity sensitive to inorganic cations.
Cell surface adhesion protein which mediates both yeast-to-host tissue adherence and yeast aggregation. Plays an important role in the biofilm formation and pathogenesis of C. albicans infections.

protein_name: Cell division topological specificity factor MinE
description: MinE of the Min system forms a ring-like structure that plays a critical role in triggering the oscillation cycle and thus facilitating placement of the division septum at the midcell. To form this ring, MinE self-assembles into amyloid fibril-like structures on the supported lipid bilayer.
The fibers formed by this protein protrude from the 5-fold vertices of the adenovirus virion and are the cell attachment points of the virus.

The sequence of the Escherichia coli OsmB protein was found to resemble that of the C-terminal region of the beta amyloid protein of Alzheimer's disease. The peptide OsmB(28-44) forms amyloid fibrils, however the associated functional relevance is not known.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in familial amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, a progressive neurodegenerative disease.

Vitronectin is present within the deposits associated with Alzheimer disease (AD), age-related macular degeneration (AMD), atherosclerosis, systemic amyloidoses, and glomerulonephritis. The role of vitronectin in the pathophysiology of these diseases is currently unknown.
Whereas the isolated Id2 HLH motif is highly helical, large C-terminal Id2 fragments including the NES sequence are either unordered or aggregation-prone. The biological relevance of this is unknown.
The functional benefits of the prion form are not known.
SARS coronavirus E protein forms cation-selective ion channels. The amyloidogenic nature of TK9 might be important for channel formation.

protein_name: N-terminal part of atrial natriuretic peptide, ANP
description: Pathogenic amyloid implicated in senile amyloid of atria of heart.

VP4 forms unusual intracellular tubule-like structures during viral infection that deform the host cytoskeleton and nucleus, which is potentially associated with IBDV lytic infection. The assembly of VP4 reduces the cytotoxicity of protease activity in host cells which might prevent the premature cell death and facilitate viral replication.
Role in bacterial biofilm formation.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in British-type cerebral amyloid angiopathy.
Taken from dedicated databases for amyloidogenic peptides. Biological relevance not known.
Taken from dedicated databases for amyloidogenic peptides. Biological relevance not known.
The peptide corresponding to the 434 Cro helix 4 has low water solubility and forms amyloid fibres.
The C-terminal fragments of both alpha- and beta-tubulin are closely associated to the amyloid deposits of familial amyloidosis, British type.

AChE normally resides mainly on cholinergic neuronal membranes, but is abnormally localized to senile plaques in Alzheimer's disease. AChE and A beta interact in vitro; the fibrillogenic region within AChE may be relevant to the interaction of AChE with amyloid fibrils formed by Abeta.
Members of the cystatin superfamily are involved in an inherited form of cerebral amyloid angiopathy and readily form amyloid fibrils in vitro.

Despite the fibrillogenic regions present in HsTPI, the enzyme maintained under native-favoring conditions displayed low fibrillogenic propensity. This amyloid-resistance can be attributed to the three-dimensional arrangement of the protein, where -strands, susceptible to aggregation, are protected in the core of the molecule. Destabilization of the protein structure may expose inner regions promoting -aggregation, as well as the formation of hydrophobic disordered aggregates.
Bacterial biofilm component and secreted virulence factor.

protein_name: Accessory gene regulator D amphipathic leader sequence, N-AgrD
description: N-AgrD, like the phenol-soluble modulins, is found in the amyloid fibrils of S. aureus biofilms and is capable of forming and seeding amyloid fibrils in vitro. N-AgrD displays cytolytic and proinflammatory properties that are abrogated after fibril formation.
Peptide hormones are stored in the form of functional amyloids in pituitary secretory granules.
Peptide hormones are stored in the form of functional amyloids in pituitary secretory granules.
Peptide hormones are stored in the form of functional amyloids in pituitary secretory granules.
Peptide hormones are stored in the form of functional amyloids in pituitary secretory granules.
Cn-AMP2 is an antimicrobial peptide derived from liquid endosperm of coconut.
Pathogenic amyloid implicated in Danish-type cerebral amyloid angiopathy.

D 6 is an antimicrobial peptide that self-assembles into fibrils, which agglutinate both Gram-negative and -positive bacteria, and block the invasion of mammalian mucosal cells by the human gastrointestinal pathogen, Listeria monocytogenes, Salmonella typhimurium and Yersinia enterocolitica.

PB1-F2 is involved in virulence by inducing mitochondria-mediated immune cells apoptosis through membrane disruptive activity. The membrane-lytic activity of PB1-F2 is closely related to its amyloid-like supramolecular organization.
